title: A Peaceful Mountain Town in Western Canada Is Shaken by Deadly Shooting
summary: Tumbler Ridge sits at the foothills of the Rocky Mountains in northeastern British Columbia, and is surrounded by expansive mountain ranges and a geological park.

title: Prosecutors Fail to Bring Charges Against Democrats Involved in Illegal Orders Video
summary: The rejection was a remarkable rebuke, suggesting that ordinary citizens did not believe that the lawmakers had committed any crimes.

title: Trump Wants to Revive Shipping. Investors Are Slow to Back Him.
summary: A French logistics behemoth promised $20 billion for the United States, but a year into President Trump’s second term, only a fraction of the money has arrived.

title: Before Trump Blasted U.S.-Canada Bridge, Owner of Competing Span Lobbied Administration
summary: A Detroit billionaire met with Howard Lutnick, the commerce secretary, hours before President Trump said he would block the opening of a new bridge connecting Detroit to Canada, officials said.

title: House Defeats Republican Bid to Block Votes on Trump’s Tariffs
summary: Three Republicans joined Democrats in rejecting a bid by G.O.P. leaders to continue skirting a law that requires the House to vote promptly on measures challenging President Trump’s tariffs.

title: ‘No Reason He Should Have Died’: Alex Pretti’s Parents Open Up
summary: In their first sit-down interview, Michael and Susan Pretti avoided recriminations and recalled the son that Michael called “an exceptionally kind, caring man.”

title: Top Border Official Praised Agent Who Shot Chicago Woman, Evidence Shows
summary: A Border Patrol agent shot Marimar Martinez five times, claiming that she tried to run him over. Newly released videos and text messages reveal fresh details about what happened.

title: Don Lemon Hires Federal Prosecutor Joseph H. Thompson in Minneapolis Church Protest Case
summary: Facing charges over his role at a church protest, Mr. Lemon, a journalist, retained a veteran litigator who recently resigned from the U.S. attorney’s office in Minnesota.

title: Away From Pomp of Olympics, Homeless Shiver on Streets of Milan
summary: Six homeless people have died in the Italian city in recent weeks, highlighting the widening inequality as the Games unfold there.

title: Former Palm Beach Police Chief Said Trump Told Him ‘Everyone’ Knew About Epstein in 2006
summary: Michael Reiter, a former Palm Beach police chief, described a 2006 conversation with Donald Trump to the F.B.I. years later, according to a newly released document.

title: Lutnick Acknowledges Traveling to Epstein’s Island
summary: The commerce secretary, Howard Lutnick, acknowledged at a Senate hearing that he and his family visited Jeffrey Epstein on his private island.

title: Peter Attia’s Ties to Epstein Spark a Backlash From Doctors
summary: What started as a rebuke of Dr. Attia has become a discussion about his credentials, longevity medicine and whom patients should trust.

title: Epstein Files Reveal Efforts to Build Ties With Russian Officials, Including Putin
summary: New documents detail Jeffrey Epstein’s efforts to foster strategic, sometimes reciprocal relationships with Russian officials.

title: F.D.A. Refuses to Review Moderna Flu Vaccine
summary: The vaccine maker’s shots involve the successful Covid vaccines’ RNA technology. Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has broadly rejected it, canceling millions of dollars in research projects.

title: Climate Change Is Erased From Reference Manual on Scientific Evidence for Judges
summary: After Republican criticism, a group that offers professional resources to judges withdrew a climate science chapter from its Reference Manual on Scientific Evidence.

title: Behind the E.P.A.’s Rush to Repeal the Endangerment Finding
summary: The agency is racing to repeal a scientific finding that requires it to fight global warming. Experts say the goal is to get the matter before the justices while President Trump is still in office.

title: Mexican Cartel’s Seized Ammunition Is Traced to U.S. Army Plant
summary: About 137,000 .50-caliber rounds have been seized since 2012, and of those, 47 percent came from a plant in Kansas City, Mo., Mexico’s defense secretary said.

title: Man Accused of Killing His Father Said He Was on a ‘Mission From God’
summary: In a courtroom in Ireland, prosecutors detailed the rambling, manic confessions of Henry McGowan, the New York man charged with murdering his father in a luxury hotel.

title: A Desperate Father, a Troubled Son and Death in a 5-Star Hotel
summary: Henry McGowan headed for Europe, showing signs of mental distress. His father, John McGowan, raced after him. This week, the son will stand trial in Ireland, accused of his father’s murder.

title: Hong Kong Activist Anna Kwok’s Father Convicted of National Security Crime
summary: In her first interview about her father, the exiled Hong Kong activist Anna Kwok said the authorities were targeting her family to try to silence her.

title: Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl Halftime Show and the Everyday People Who Made It Authentic
summary: A priest from Sacramento. A bar owner from New York. A taquero from Los Angeles. Puerto Rico came alive at the Super Bowl because of hundreds of non-famous performers.

title: Britney Spears Sells Her Song Catalog
summary: The pop hitmaker, who hasn’t released a new album in 10 years, sold the rights to her music to Primary Wave.

title: Dissidents Are Silenced, and the West Moves On
summary: On Jimmy Lai and the future of freedom.

title: A.I. May Put Progressives to the Test
summary: The left needs a sharper A.I. politics.

title: Late Night Mines Trump’s Million Mentions in the Epstein Files
summary: “A million times? There’s not even that many references to Hamlet in the play ‘Hamlet,’” Jordan Klepper said on “The Daily Show.”

title: California Man Sentenced to 4 Years for Covert Work on China’s Behalf
summary: The man, Mike Sun, corresponded with Chinese government officials, monitored the visit of Taiwan’s president to California and backed the election of a city council member, according to court documents.

title: Baboon Sibling Rivalry Suggests Monkeys Feel Jealousy Like People
summary: Young primates in a southern African nature park were observed to constantly interfere when their mother was giving attention to a younger brother or sister.

title: Ford Says Electric Vehicle Losses Will Continue for 3 More Years
summary: Ford Motor reported a big loss for 2025 because of its troubled electric vehicle division, which it has significantly scaled back.

title: Elon Musk Wants to Build an A.I. Satellite Factory on the Moon
summary: In a meeting with employees at his company xAI, Mr. Musk revealed a vision for a facility that includes a giant catapult to launch his satellites into space.
